text: British Columbia Highway 95 is a highway in British Columbia that travels north-south in the Rocky Mountains area. It is connected from the U.S. Route 95. The south end is the Canadaâ€“United States border and the north end is at with a junction with Highway 1. It is also concurrent with Highway 3 between near Creston to the beginning of the Highway 93 concurrency near Cranbrook and concurrent with Highway 93 between near Cranbrook to Radium Hot Springs. ==Related pages== *Golden, British Columbia *British Columbia Highway 93 Category:British Columbia provincial highways
title: British Columbia Highway 95
